body_html:
It was a fresh clone of the master.

While in root of the repo I built the image with

docker build -f ./tools/docker/Dockerfile9 -t pytorch .

I had also tried manually running submodule update --init before building the image, but it still failed

AWS ubuntu p2.xlarge w/ CUDA 9.0, cuDNN 7, Nvidia 384.81
body_text:
It was a fresh clone of the master.
While in root of the repo I built the image with
docker build -f ./tools/docker/Dockerfile9 -t pytorch .

body:
It was a fresh clone of the master. 

While in root of the repo I built the image with 

``` 
docker build -f ./tools/docker/Dockerfile9 -t pytorch . 
``` 

I had also tried manually running submodule update --init before building the image, but it still failed 


AWS ubuntu p2.xlarge w/ CUDA 9.0, cuDNN 7, Nvidia 384.81
